Really disappointed with I2P. I want to like it - but it's so slow. Zeronet is very fast most of the time.

As far as I'm concerned, ZeroNet is the calvary I2P hasn't found yet. Once ZeroNet operates over I2P - then we'll have a reason to run I2P. Currently, ZeroNet only operates over Tor.

1603608731_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body: I would not. Unless the replacement executed on superior performance and offered significant compatibility with the old system. That's a pretty hard moat. Most who attempt things like this fail. There are advantages and disadvantages to having a single developer. For what it is worth, perceived code quality is a function of speed. I will tolerate slow BitTorrent performance - IF the GUI remains responsive.

1608156151_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: "Eighteen" was generally a limit only because it encouraged young people to get out and start their own families. Not waste time. Female biology is a rather hard limit, and no amount of wokeism will change the fact that childbearing generally occurs between 16 and 30 - or not at all. Much of this changed when entry level jobs started getting snapped up by foreign nationals. It seriously damaged the employment ladder for natives. At one time, a young man could still support his wife and children without exotic "training".  The work was easily available...one bettered themselves only in an attempt to tackle more complex and better paid work. Not sure if any of these wonderful plans actually worked. It seems that "training" just devolved into parking people until something could be found for them. Meanwhile, those with ability never seemed to benefit from "training" - they educated themselves.
